songTitle: Bát bồng, nhất trò, xuân nữ

phrases.text: Chầu rày đã có trăng non
phrases.english: (name: Chầu) sieve/now already/past marker have/there is moon young/tender

culturalContext.description: The moon ("trăng") is central to Vietnamese romantic imagery. Separated lovers traditionally looked at the same moon to feel connected across distance. As the opening phrase, this establishes the song's emotional tone and invites audience engagement.
facts: Vietnamese Mid-Autumn Festival (Tết Trung Thu) celebrates the moon with lion dances, mooncakes, and children's lanterns
The moon appears in Vietnamese proverbs: "Trăng rằm tháng tám" (full moon of 8th month) represents peak beauty
Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Opening phrases in Vietnamese folk songs often use vocatives (ơi, này) to grab attention before the narrative begins
culturalContext.musicalContext: The 6-syllable structure (song lục) balances melody with text, common in Southern traditions. As the opening phrase, it establishes the tonal center and introduces the melodic motif that will be varied throughout.

phrases.text: Để anh lên xuống mà có con em bồng
phrases.english: to/leave you (older brother/male) go up go down that/which have/there is classifier (animals) you (younger) carry in arms

culturalContext.description: This narrative phrase contributes to the song's narrative structure and emotional arc, typical of Northern folk traditions.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
Đàn tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are 20th century innovations - originals were vocal

phrases.text: Đi đâu mà sách đi hoài
phrases.english: go where that/which book go always/constantly

culturalContext.description: This question phrase contributes to the song's narrative structure and emotional arc, typical of Northern folk traditions.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
Đàn tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are 20th century innovations - originals were vocal
culturalContext.musicalContext: The 6-syllable structure (song lục) balances melody with text, common in Southern traditions. Question phrases in Vietnamese folk music traditionally end on an unstable pitch (2nd or 5th scale degree) creating anticipation for the answer.

phrases.text: Cử nhân chẳng có mà tú tài cũng không
phrases.english: 举 (scholar) human not have/there is that/which talented talent also/too not/no

culturalContext.description: "Ông" is a respectful address for married men. Its use in this context shows the formal politeness maintained in Vietnamese, even when criticizing one's husband.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
Đàn tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are 20th century innovations - originals were vocal

phrases.text: Đi đâu mang sách đi hoài
phrases.english: go where bring/carry book go always/constantly

culturalContext.description: This question phrase contributes to the song's narrative structure and emotional arc, typical of Northern folk traditions.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
Đàn tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are 20th century innovations - originals were vocal
culturalContext.musicalContext: The 6-syllable structure (song lục) balances melody with text, common in Southern traditions. Positioned at the song's midpoint, this phrase likely marks a structural pivot or climax in the narrative. Question phrases in Vietnamese folk music traditionally end on an unstable pitch (2nd or 5th scale degree) creating anticipation for the answer.

phrases.text: Cử nhân không đậu tú tài cũng không
phrases.english: 举 (scholar) human not/no bean talented talent also/too not/no

culturalContext.description: "Ông" is a respectful address for married men. Its use in this context shows the formal politeness maintained in Vietnamese, even when criticizing one's husband.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
Đàn tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are 20th century innovations - originals were vocal

phrases.text: Dù không ngon cũng bánh ít lá gai
phrases.english: although/even though not/no delicious also/too cake/pastry few/little leaf gai [?]

culturalContext.description: "Ông" is a respectful address for married men. Its use in this context shows the formal politeness maintained in Vietnamese, even when criticizing one's husband.

phrases.text: Dù anh có dại cũng trai trò học trò
phrases.english: although/even though you (older brother/male) have/there is dại [?] also/too young man student study student

culturalContext.description: As the closing phrase, this provides resolution and often returns to opening themes for circular structure.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
Đàn tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are 20th century innovations - originals were vocal
culturalContext.musicalContext: As the closing phrase, it typically returns to the tonic note and may quote the opening melody for circular structure.
